de.saschafeldmann.adesso.master.thesis.detection.algorithm

Interface DetectionAlgorithm<ConceptType extends Concept>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CardinalRelationConceptDetection, FillInTheBlankConceptDetection

    public interface DetectionAlgorithm<ConceptType extends Concept>
    Project: Masterthesis of Sascha Feldmann Creation date: 29.06.2016 Author: Sascha Feldmann (sascha.feldmann@gmx.de)

    University: Hochschule f√ºr Technik und Wirtschaft, Berlin Fachbereich 4 Studiengang Internationale Medieninformatik (Master)

    Company: adesso AG

    Implementations of the detection algorithm are able to identify their special concepts and build Concept instances as output.
    Conceps are detected upon previously filled LearningContent.
    A concept also fulfills the definition of a text plan as introduced by [Reiter] in their book on Natural Language Generation.
    A concept is the first step to create questions since they structure information detected within the unstructured natural language processing annotated LearningContent.
    Following [Reiter] in his proposal of a natural language generation system, a concept is the result of the document planner which did the tasks of the content determination ("what information should be communicated?").
    See: Reiter, E., Dale, R., & Feng, Z. (2000). Building natural language generation systems (Vol. 33). Cambridge: Cambridge university press.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<ConceptType> execute(LearningContent learningContent, DetectionOptions detectionOptions)
      Executes the algorithm to detect the special ConceptType (a Concept) within the given learningContent.

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        java.util.List<ConceptType> execute(LearningContent learningContent,
                                    DetectionOptions detectionOptions)
        Executes the algorithm to detect the special ConceptType (a Concept) within the given learningContent. Therefore, use the part-of-speech and named-entity-annotated texts within the LearningContent.
        Parameters:
        learningContent - the learning content for which the ConceptType shall be detected
        detectionOptions - options to be thread-safe
        Returns:
        a list of detected concepts in the given LearningContent.
